metadata.title: Chest X-Ray Interpretation (Basic)
metadata.description: Structured rubric for basic chest X-ray interpretation skills.
metadata.author: Casewise System

categories.name: Core Assessment
categories.description: Core components of chest X-ray interpretation.

criteria.name: Technical Assessment
criteria.description: Evaluates image quality, positioning, and technical factors affecting interpretation.
criteria.rationale: Technical assessment ensures reliable interpretation and identifies limitations.

scoring_guide.0: No mention of technical factors or poor image quality
scoring_guide.1: Mentions some technical factors but incomplete assessment
scoring_guide.2: Comprehensive evaluation of positioning, exposure, and image quality

criteria.name: Cardiac Evaluation
criteria.description: Assesses cardiac size, shape, and position including cardiothoracic ratio.
criteria.rationale: Cardiac assessment is fundamental to chest X-ray interpretation and guides further workup.

scoring_guide.1: Mentions cardiac size without specific measurements or descriptors
scoring_guide.2: Accurately measures cardiothoracic ratio and describes cardiac configuration

criteria.name: Pulmonary Vascular Assessment
criteria.description: Evaluates pulmonary vascular pattern, including vessel size and distribution.
criteria.rationale: Pulmonary vascular assessment is crucial for detecting pulmonary hypertension and heart failure.

scoring_guide.1: General mention of vessels without specific assessment
scoring_guide.2: Detailed assessment of vascular pattern, size, and distribution

criteria.name: Lung Field Analysis
criteria.description: Systematic evaluation of lung fields for infiltrates, masses, or other abnormalities.
criteria.rationale: Comprehensive lung field analysis is essential for detecting pulmonary pathology.

scoring_guide.1: Partial evaluation of lung fields or missing key areas
scoring_guide.2: Complete systematic evaluation of all lung zones including apices and bases

criteria.name: Pleural Space Evaluation
criteria.description: Assesses for pleural effusions, pneumothorax, or pleural thickening.
criteria.rationale: Pleural assessment is critical for detecting effusions and pneumothorax.

scoring_guide.1: Mentions pleural space without specific findings
scoring_guide.2: Detailed assessment of pleural spaces including costophrenic angles

criteria.name: Clinical Impression
criteria.description: Provides prioritized list of findings with clinical correlation.
criteria.rationale: Clear impression guides clinical decision-making and next steps.

scoring_guide.2: Prioritized impression with clinical significance and recommendations
